b'World features Vampires vs Werewolves, Cities vs Nature, Lovecraftian madness vs order and Surface vs Underworld themes. Perfect! #6'
b'One of the heroes, a Warlock, is actually a Herald of a Lovecraftian World-Eating entity. #5'
b'World only has rain when moon glows green and forest explode, attacking civilization. #4'
b'The world houses a fallen Lovecraftian god and a "green moon" diety that causes explosive forest growth. #3'
b'Vampires have fled to cities while Were-creature lords rule forest kingdoms. #3'
b'Low level magic is hyper common through industrialized potions and alchemy. High magic died and all elves died out or left. #2'
b'My campaign: Humans retreated to mountain cities linked by glass railways. World is covered with forests ruled by lycantrophes. #1'
b"We created the most amazing RPG setting tonight. So much awesome I can't contain it!"
b'RT @frequentbeef: @ChattyDM These are great - have you checked out the Dresden Files world-building steps? Very similar. Think you\xe2\x80\x99d find p\xe2\x80\xa6'
b'Ex of Strange Phenomenon: Low-level magic is extremely common. Impact: Variant Healing potions as Street drugs and Magic Missile "firearms"'
b'And the one I talked about earlier: 5a) Describe a strange Phenomenon in the City/World 5b) Describe its impact on everyday life. 6/6'
b'4a) Describe a person (Not necessarily humanoid) of note from IN or OUT of the city. 4b) What is your relationship with that person?'
